meanings.definition: Moving or twisting in a wriggling motion
meanings.sent1: The squirmy puppy wiggled happily in the grass.
meanings.sent2: The toddler felt squirmy as she tried to sit still during storytime.
meanings.sent3: The squirmy worm danced around in the rain.
meanings.sent4: The squirmy snake slithered through the tall grass.
meanings.sent5: The squirmy caterpillar transformed into a beautiful butterfly.

meanings.sent1: The squirmy feeling in his stomach made him nervous before the test.
meanings.sent2: The dark, squirmy alley gave her an eerie feeling.
meanings.sent3: The squirmy chair made strange noises every time someone sat on it.
meanings.sent4: The squirmy silence in the room made everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The squirmy suspense in the movie kept everyone on the edge of their seats.

meanings.sent1: The squirmy dance performance captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: The squirmy fish darted around the coral reef.
meanings.sent3: The squirmy branches of the tree swayed in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The squirmy crowd of fans cheered wildly at the concert.
meanings.sent5: The squirmy line of ants marched in a straight line across the sidewalk.
